1.text: The unjust fled and none pursuing, and the just shall be confident as the young lion.

2.text: In the transgression of a land many its chiefs: and by a man understanding to know, the place shall be extended.

3.text: A poor man oppressing the poor, a sweeping rain and no bread.

4.text: They forsaking the law will praise the unjust: and they watching the law, shall contend with them.

5.text: Men of evil shall not understand judgment: and they seeking Jehovah shall understand all.

6.text: Good the poor one going in his integrity above him perverting the ways, and he the rich.

7.text: He watching the law a son understanding: and the companion of squanderers will shame his father.

8.text: He increasing by interest and usury, he shall gather it for him compassionating the poor.

9.text: He turning away his ear from hearing the law, also his prayer is an abomination.

10.text: He causing the upright to wander in an evil way, into his pit shall he fall: and the good shall inherit complete things.

11.text: The rich man is wise in his eyes, and the poor one understanding shall search him out.

12.text: In the rejoicing of the just, much glory: in the rising up of the unjust, man will hide himself.

13.text: He covering his transgression shall not prosper: but he confessing and forsaking, shall be compassionated.

14.text: Happy the man fearing always: and he hardening his heart shall fall into evil.

15.text: A roaring lion and a greedy bear the unjust one ruling over a poor people.

16.text: A prince wanting understanding and great in oppressions: he hating gain shall lengthen the days.

17.text: He terrifying violence upon the blood of a soul shall flee even to the pit; none shall hold fast upon him.

18.text: He going uprightly shall be saved; and he being violent in the ways shall fall at once.

19.text: He working his land shall be filled with bread: and he pursuing the vain shall be filled with poverty.

20.text: A man of faithfulness multiplied blessings: and he hasting to be rich shall not be innocent.

21.text: To look upon faces is not good and for a morsel of bread the man will transgress.

22.text: A man of evil eye hasted for riches, and knew not that want shall come upon him.

23.text: He reproving a man, afterwards shall find favor more than he smoothing the tongue.

24.text: He stripping his father and his mother, and saying, No transgression; is companion to a man destroying.

25.text: He enlarging the soul shall excite strife: and he trusting upon Jehovah shall he made fat.

26.text: He trusting in his heart is foolish: and he going in wisdom shall be delivered.

27.text: He giving to the poor wants not: and he hiding his eyes increased curses.

28.text: In the rising up of the unjust, man shalt hide: and in their perishing, the lust shall increase.
